definitions.definition: The determination of the concentration of some substance in a solution by slowly adding measured amounts of some other substance (normally using a burette ) until a reaction is shown to be complete , for instance by the colour change of an indicator .

main_definition: ( analytical chemistry ) The determination of the concentration of some substance in a solution by slowly adding measured amounts of some other substance (normally using a burette ) until a reaction is shown to be complete , for instance by the colour change of an indicator .
